sen.j: 岸本辰雄（きしもと たつお、1851年11月13日（嘉永3年10月10日 (旧暦)） - 1912年（明治45年）4月5日）は日本の法学者。
sen.e: Tatsuo KISHIMOTO (November 13, 1851-April 5, 1912) was a law scholar in Japan.
Tatsuo KISHIMOTO (November 13, 1851-April 5, 1912) was a law scholar in Japan.
Tatsuo KISHIMOTO (November 13, 1851-April 5, 1912) was a law scholar in Japan.
He was the founder of Meiji University.
He was the founder of Meiji University.
He was the founder of Meiji University.

sen.j: 現在の鳥取市に鳥取藩武士岸本平次郎の三男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born the third son of Heijiro KISHIMOTO, a retainer of the Tottori Domain in present Tottori City.
He was born as the third son of Heijiro KISHIMOTO, a samurai of the Tottori Domain in present Tottori City.
sen.cmt: the third sonの前にasを挿入し、retainerをsamuraiに変更しました。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Heijiro KISHIMOTO, a samurai of the Tottori Domain in present Tottori City.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争従軍後、1870年に鳥取藩の推薦を受け、開成学校（後の東京大学）に入学。
sen.e: After fighting the Boshin War, he enrolled Kaisei School (later Tokyo University) in 1870 upon the recommendation of the Tottori Domain.
After taking part in a campaign of the Boshin War, he enrolled Kaisei School (later Tokyo University) in 1870 upon the recommendation of the Tottori Domain.
After taking part in a campaign of the Boshin War, he enrolled Kaisei School (later Tokyo University) in 1870 upon the recommendation of the Tottori Domain.

sen.j: 1872年8月、司法省法学校第1期生として入学、ギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードの薫陶を受ける。
sen.e: In August 1872, he enrolled Shihosho Hogakko (a law school later absorbed into Tokyo University) as its inaugural student and studied under Gustave Emile BOISSONADE.
In August 1872, he enrolled Shihosho Hogakko (a law school later absorbed into Tokyo University) as its inaugural student and studied under Gustave Emile BOISSONADE.
In August 1872, he enrolled Shihosho Hogakko (a law school later absorbed into Tokyo University) as its inaugural student and studied under Gustave Emile BOISSONADE.
He graduated from the school in July 1876.
He graduated from the school in July 1876.
He graduated from the school in July 1876.

sen.j: その後、フランスのパリ大学に留学し、1880年に帰国。
sen.e: He enrolled the University of Paris in France later and returned to Japan in 1880.
He enrolled the University of Paris in France later and returned to Japan in 1880.
He enrolled the University of Paris in France later and returned to Japan in 1880.

sen.j: 1881年、宮城浩蔵、矢代操らとともに明治大学の前身である明治法律学校を創設、初代校長となる。
sen.e: In 1881, together with Kozo MIYAGI and Misao YASHIRO, Kishimoto founded Meiji Law School, the predecessor of Meiji University, and became the first president of the school.
In 1881, together with Kozo MIYAGI and Misao YASHIRO, KISHIMOTO founded Meiji Law School, the predecessor of Meiji University, and became the first president of the school.
sen.cmt: KISHIMOTOと大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1881, together with Kozo MIYAGI and Misao YASHIRO, KISHIMOTO founded Meiji Law School, the predecessor of Meiji University, and became the first president of the school.

sen.j: 宮城浩蔵が刑事法を担当したのに対し、岸本は矢代操と分担して民事法を担当した。
sen.e: Kozo MIYAGI lectured on criminal law while Kishimoto and Misao YASHIRO took it in turn to lecture on civil law.
Kozo MIYAGI lectured on criminal law while KISHIMOTO and Misao YASHIRO took it in turn to lecture on civil law.
sen.cmt: KISHIMOTOと大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: Kozo MIYAGI lectured on criminal law while KISHIMOTO and Misao YASHIRO took it in turn to lecture on civil law.

sen.j: 法制局参事官、司法省参事官、大審院判事を歴任。
sen.e: He held the posts of a councilor of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, a councilor for the Ministry of Justice, and a judge of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
He held the posts of a councilor of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, a councilor for the Ministry of Justice, and a judge of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).
He held the posts of a councilor of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, a councilor for the Ministry of Justice, and a judge of Daishin-in (Predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).

sen.j: 1889年には地元の鳥取県から第1回衆議院議員総選挙に立候補するが、すぐに辞退している。
sen.e: In 1889, he ran for the first Lower House elections from Tottori Prefecture, his constituency, but withdrew from elections soon afterwards.
In 1889, he ran for the first Lower House elections from Tottori Prefecture, his constituency, but withdrew from elections soon afterwards.
In 1889, he ran for the first Lower House elections from Tottori Prefecture, his constituency, but withdrew from elections soon afterwards.
In 1890, he was assigned to a judge of Daishin-in.
In 1890, he was assigned to a judge of Daishin-in.
In 1890, he was assigned to a judge of Daishin-in.
In 1893, he was certified as an attorney.
In 1893, he was certified as an attorney.
In 1893, he was certified as an attorney.

sen.j: 1912年、鉄道で明治大学へ向かう途中に脳貧血で死去。
sen.e: In 1912, he died from cerebral anemia on his way to Meiji University by train.
In 1912, he died from cerebral anemia on his way to Meiji University by train.
In 1912, he died from cerebral anemia on his way to Meiji University by train.

sen.j: 墓所は谷中霊園乙4号9側。
sen.e: His grave is located on the Second 2-9 site of Yanaka Cemetery.
His grave is located on the Second 4-9 site of Yanaka Cemetery.
sen.cmt: 数字の誤記を4に訂正しました。
sen.e: His grave is located on the Second 4-9 site of Yanaka Cemetery.
